Suffolk Libraries

New films and DVDs for July 2015

Jul 1, 2015 • Brandon King

Home

DreamWorks animated adventure about the unlikely friendship between Oh, an alien (voiced by Jim Parsons of The Big Bang Theory fame) and a human girl, Tip (voiced by Rihanna).

 

Focus

Comedy drama about con-artists in a messy relationship, starring Will Smith and Margot Robbie.

 

The woman in black: Angel of death

Horror sequel about World War Two Blitz-evacuated children haunted by the spirit of Jennette Humfrye, known as ‘The Woman in Black’.

 

Chappie

Sci-fi thriller starring Dev Patel and Hugh Jackman. Chappie is the first robot programmed to have human emotions, intended to improve its performance as police control.

 

Still Alice

Successful professor Alice Howland (Julianne Moore) is diagnosed with an early onset of Alzheimer’s disease. We also stock the novel on which the film is based in our catalogue.

 

Suite Francaise

World War Two romance between a French woman and a German soldier.
